alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 7:57PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cumberland County through 845 PM CDT... At 755 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Crossville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Crab Orchard, Lake Tansi and Cumberland Mountain State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 327 and 339. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
